Package database

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • database.Database
  • public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to access the Apache Derby database and the methods are used to query information from the database
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jackson O'Donnell, Bryan Lee

    • Method Detail

      • executeUpdate

        public static java.lang.Boolean executeUpdate​(java.lang.String instructions)
        This method allows communication with the database by way of specified SQL statements. This method is specifically for updating the database and will not return a ResultSet.
        Parameters:
        instructions - an SQL command to be run
        Returns:
        True if the SQL command runs properly, False otherwise

      • executeQuery

        public static java.sql.ResultSet executeQuery​(java.lang.String instructions)
        This method allows communication with the database by way of specified SQL statements. This method is specifically for retrieving information from the database and subsequently returns a ResultSet
        Parameters:
        instructions - an SQL command to be run
        Returns:
        A ResultSet that contains the requested information, or a null value if the SQL statement fails.

      • executeInstruction

        public static java.lang.Boolean executeInstruction​(java.lang.String instructions)
        This method allows any SQL statement specified to be run. This method does not allow the retrieval of information as it does not return a ResultSet.
        Parameters:
        instructions - an SQL command to be run
        Returns:
        Returns True if the SQL command executes properly, False otherwise.

      • select_UserName_fromDB

        public boolean select_UserName_fromDB​(java.lang.String userName,
                                      java.lang.String tableName)
                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method allows a SQL statement specified to be run. This method does not allow the retrieval of information as it does not return a ResultSet.
        Parameters:
        userName - the Key used to access the database
        tableName - the SQL table to be accessed
        Returns:
        Returns True if the SQL command locates the User information in the given table.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • insert_Into_Users_Table

        public void insert_Into_Users_Table​(java.lang.String tableName,
                                    java.lang.String userName,
                                    java.lang.String realname,
                                    java.lang.String password)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method allows a SQL statement specified to be run. This method specifically inserts new User Login information into the database
        Parameters:
        userName - the Key used to access the database
        realname - the User's real name
        password - the User's desire login password
        tableName - the SQL table to be accessed
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if query is incorrect

      • select_Password_fromDB

        public boolean select_Password_fromDB​(java.lang.String password)
                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method allows a SQL statement specified to be run. This method checks the UserLogin database to authenticate the password
        Parameters:
        password - the user entered item to be checked
        Returns:
        Returns True if the SQL command locates the User password in the given table.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if query is incorrect

      • select_fromDB

        public java.lang.String select_fromDB​(java.lang.String exercise,
                                      java.lang.String userName)
                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method allows a SQL statement specified to be run. This method quickly checks the OneRep database to see if the user is already in the database
        Parameters:
        userName - the key to be checked
        exercise - also part of the primary key needed to be checked
        Returns:
        Returns a the amount lifted in the exercise or -1 if the user is not in the database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if query is incorrect

      • insert_into_onerep_table

        public void insert_into_onerep_table​(java.lang.String tableName,
                                     java.lang.String bench,
                                     java.lang.String squat,
                                     java.lang.String deadlift,
                                     java.lang.String username)
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method allows any SQL statement specified to be run. This method specifically inserts new User Maximum rep information into the database
        Parameters:
        username - the Key used to access the database
        deadlift - exercise type
        squat - exercise type
        tableName - the SQL table to be accessed
        bench - exercise type
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if query is incorrect

      • updateRecordIntoDbUserTable

        public void updateRecordIntoDbUserTable​(java.lang.String exercise,
                                        java.lang.String amount,
                                        java.lang.String userName)
                                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method updates the information in the OneRep table with a simple SQL query.
        Parameters:
        exercise - the type of Exercise to be updated
        amount - updated Weight that can be lifted
        userName - the key used for the table
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if query is incorrect

      • insertIntoUserProfile

        public void insertIntoUserProfile​(java.lang.String userName,
                                  int protein,
                                  int carbs,
                                  int fat,
                                  java.lang.String height,
                                  java.lang.String weight,
                                  java.lang.String caloires)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method allows a SQL statement specified to be run. This method specifically inserts new User Profile information into the database
        Parameters:
        userName - the Key used to access the database
        protein - macronutrient in grams
        carbs - macronutrient in grams
        fat - macronutrient in grams
        height - users height
        caloires - users total calorie consumption per day
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if query is incorrect

                                           int protein,

                                           int fat,
                                           java.lang.String height,
                                           java.lang.String weight,
                                           java.lang.String calories)

        protein - macronutrient in grams

        fat - macronutrient in grams
        height - users height
        calories - users total calorie consumption per day
        userName - the key used for the table

        java.sql.SQLException - if query is incorrect

      • convertStringForDatabase

        public java.lang.String convertStringForDatabase​(java.lang.String str)
        This method is used to quickly convert strings into SQL compatible strings
        Parameters:
        str - the string to be converted into SQL string
        Returns:
        A string that is compatible with SQL commands
